website_summaries.verdict: The steep price of the Salewa Alp Trainer Mid GTX was worth it based on consumers. The boot was supportive yet lightweight. The fit, comfort and undeniable durability also impressed users. The closure system, traction and customizable insoles of the pair received praises. Likewise, its light construction and quality were appreciated. However, the Alp Trainer Mid GTX has shortcomings too. People were disappointed with its narrow width and blister-causing heel region. Its lackluster breathability also didn’t win the favor of a professional footwear critic.
pros: The premium price of the boot paid off, as mentioned by several consumers
Many appreciated the support of the Alp Trainer Mid GTX
The right-out-of-the-box fit was admired by a couple of buyers
A high percentage of users were mesmerized with the grip of the hiking boot
They have tried it on different surfaces including wet, rocky, muddy and snowy ones
They did not have any issues with its traction
Despite the bulky appearance, the pair still offered a lightweight feel, according to a few satisfied wearers
One of them, an expert, barely noticed that he was wearing any boots at all
Numerous users admired the comfort brought by the Salewa Alp Trainer Mid GTX
The customizable insole was splendid, as noted by a handful of purchasers
They said that they were able to get their desired fit with just the interchangeable layer of the insole
Several users approved of its quality and well-thought-out design
The durability of the pair was undeniable, as mentioned by a considerable number of Salewa brand loyalists
Its excellent lacing system astounded one professional gear reviewer
cons: A significant percentage of wearers found the boot to be too narrow
Some users were displeased as they developed blisters in the heel area
One saved her heel by using athletic tapes
An expert had to complain about the boot’s insufficient breathability

customer_reviews.title: Light boots, confortable, good fit
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how light these boots are! Oct update: Used these for hiking several trails in the Mendenhall glacier area and other locations in Alaska. Although trails are reasonably well maintained, these boots worked very well on gravel, small rocks, and walking across small streams, etc. Very confortable also on the streets when in towns in rainy days, indeed waterproof. Yes I would recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: EfrainWarped

customer_reviews.title: Confident boots!
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 12D and they fit perfectly, usually it's a toss up. They do take a couple days to get broke in. I wore them on a couple short 5 mile hikes and one trail was very steep with some tricky scrambles on and around loose rock, I never felt like I couldn't get a grip. It doesn't take long before to build great confidence in these lace to toe boots. Not sure how they are going to be under heavy loads and puttin in 20's, will find out and update. As far as day hikes and scrambling they are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great snug fit.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these boots 90% of the time since I live in the mountains. They fit like a glove and keep my feet and ankles from hurting. I used to spend a lot of time working out of my home on hardwood floors and these boots saved my life. No more pain from arthritis or planar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Goff

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable lightweight boots
customer_reviews.text: i tried out my new boots today with 8+ mile hike to some lakes at 11,000 feet. Very comfortable lightweight boots, especially since I only had about 2 miles on them when I started. Easy break in! We experienced melting snow, very wet trails, and a fair amount of rock scrambling; I loved the great grip these boots provided as well as how waterproof they are. I nearly always wear a 10 1/2 in both shoes and boots, these boots fit very well. My feet are a bit wide and there was plenty of room in the toes and a snug fit elsewhere. Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: BillJuv

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable junk.
customer_reviews.text: 4 months and the bottoms fell off. Have tried having them warranty but Salewa responded once that they where working on it and haven’t heard back in over three weeks. They are impossible to reach. They where comfortable but for the money would want them to hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: justin wendland

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good shoe
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good shoe, while not uncomfortable I don't feel real secure/stable in them, so I won't do major hikes where ground is rocky and major ups and downs with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Manner

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Boots for Backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: Very "sticky" tread that will keep you upright on sandy granite, mossy and wet rocks, etc. I put 23 miles on the JMT with these boots. While buddies in my group got blisters, I did not get 1!! This is even though I didn't have time to break them in before my trip.
customer_reviews.author: D. Witham

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable boots I've ever owned straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable boots I've ever owned straight out of the box. I wear a 10 US in Soloman shoes/boots. Saw some other reviews where people said they ran a little small. Got these in a 10.5 US - perfect fit with a pair of Darn Tough socks.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, so far....
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today. Put them on. The fit is perfect. They feel like they were made for my feet only. Walked about a mile down a gravel road. They are AMAZING. Literally felt like Spider-Man. The Vibram soles are grabby and rugged. They are beautifully designed. They look like you'd think hiking boots should look in 2016. No extra bulk at all. I hope they last. UPDATE: I have worn these every day since they arrived. They are far and away the finest footwear I have ever had on. I will never wear anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Pauli

customer_reviews.title: Seems comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Seems comfortable out of the box. However, one of the shoe laces arrived damaged (will likely break very soon). For nearly $200 I expect the entire product to be undamaged. Time will tell on the boots themselves. I have had excellent experience with the brand previously.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband since he's a technician and on his feet all day. For a work boot he says these are comfortable and so far they have held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: A. NicholsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a hiking boot so go up half or a ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits like a hiking boot so go up half or a whole size. Love all the laces so you get a great fit. They also look great
customer_reviews.author: KCEG

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, order a half size up
customer_reviews.text: Order a half size up. Seems like good quality. So far I’m pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Ton

customer_reviews.title: if you ask for half size bigger would be perfect, good boots
customer_reviews.text: Little small in my regular size, if you ask for half size bigger would be perfect, good boots
customer_reviews.author: danilo aguilar

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves the boots but they run a little ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the boots but they run a little small and narrow. Unfortunately we are going to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Poteet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Always liked Salewa and these are my second pair I've bought
customer_reviews.author: Brian OLeary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and design
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and design. They are pretty tight around the arch and ankle out of the box, but that’s to be expected, and they break in relatively quickly. Superb traction, support, and waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really good comfortable boots. My feet seem to get pretty hot though
customer_reviews.author: matthew brazier

customer_reviews.title: He says they are lightweight and comfortable - much better than the bulky/heavy Salomon boots he ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these boots. He wears them everyday for work and they've held up perfectly. He says they are lightweight and comfortable - much better than the bulky/heavy Salomon boots he had from L.L. Bean.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, excellent fit and support
customer_reviews.text: Light, comfortable, excellent fit and support. Perfect for challenging terrain.
customer_reviews.author: keill024

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking boots I have ever had on my feet. This will be the 3rd pair of Salewa ALP mid GTX boots I have owned. I walk around 15000 steps a day for work and feet feel great afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Catalano

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Could not even get my big toe into this boot Salewa has really gone downhill EXTREMELY DISSAPPOINTING!!
customer_reviews.author: lvs#dogz

customer_reviews.title: comfy, waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the laces go all the way to the bottom, so you can adjust them very finely. Comfy boots that require very little break-in time. Excellent waterproofing. It is a mid-weight boot. There are boots with less support, and boots with a lot more... I'd say this is about in the middle of the range of weight, stiffness, and support.
customer_reviews.author: D. Askov

customer_reviews.title: Approach shoes that can't take approach abuse
customer_reviews.text: PROS: good fit right out of the box, lightweight, waterproof and good grip on wet rocks. CONS: as an approach shoe one should expect that they could take some abuse from rocks but the protection on the side are sewed on and when the seems rub against something they break. The protective patch came loose leaving room for sand and small rocks between the shoe fabric and the patch itself - not comfortable. Impossible to repair without sewing through the gtx membrane.
customer_reviews.author: Anders

customer_reviews.title: Don’t handle cold well.  Hike when it’s dry
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots in a store on New Years Eve. I have walked 100 miles on roads and hilly trails in Michigan and Wisconsin. They fit very well, are comfortable and grip really well. But I thought they would handle weather a lot better. My feet ended up wet while hiking in a mist in early January. And they got really cold today on a five mile walk in sunny 18degree weather. My old Solomon’s would have been warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD P NEWBERG

customer_reviews.title: Comfort out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Note: bought these in Spain and not from Amazon. Light and flexible comfort right out of the box. Agree with other reviewers that these do fit a bit narrow. Normally take a 11.5-12 ( depending on manufacture) picked 12 for these. Only really notice narrowness when sitting for a while with them on. When you start to move the flexible sides stretch freely and all tightness disappears.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian Eh!

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes. Have used 'em all over the States. From NY to WY.
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for a year now. Amongst the best performing hiking shoe I've ever used and easily the best looking. Traction on rocks is amazing. Waterproof to 3-4 inches standing in a puddle. I can say these shoes have help up 100% for me after multiple camping trips; one that was 20 consecutive days of use. It is now a year into ownership and holding up great.

customer_reviews.title: It’s not close- Best hiking boots ever
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most hiking boots, these aren’t clunky or cumbersome- It’s like they were custom made. They’re sleek with NO bulk- Incredibly comfortable. Make this investment- You won’t be sorry- Buy + 1/2 size
customer_reviews.author: Tahoedirt

product_meta.title: Salewa Men's Ms Alp Trainer Mid Gore-tex High Rise Hiking Shoes
feature_bullets: Model - MS ALP TRAINER MID GTX
